title: Restore Glaciered S3 Data
text:
Restore Glaciered S3 Data

I can’t tell you how many times I’ve had to restore data from improperly configured S3 buckets.
This is a simple script that will restore all the data in a bucket that has been glaciered within 3-5 hours using rclone.
#!/usr/bin/env bash

set -eo pipefail

BUCKET="s3://my-bucket"

rclone backend restore \
    -o priority=Standard \
    -o lifetime=90 \
    $BUCKET | 2>> error.log | tee -a run.log

title: Spark and Polars
text:
Spark to polars via arrow is memory efficient.

Found this on stackoverflow.
import pyspark
import polars as pl
import pyarrow as pa

def spark2polars(sdf: pyspark.sql.DataFrame):
    pdf = pl.from_arrow(pa.Table.from_batches(sdf._collect_as_arrow()))
    return pdf
toPandas() serialization/copy looks like:

spark2polars serialization/copy looks like:







Important



Data must fit in memory.
